result.execSummary:
The defendant Thor T Lindemans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Thor T Lindemans in court with attorney Annette M Barna.  Defendant Thor T Lindemans in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached in this case.  Court reads agreement.  Court questions DE.  DE understands that he is waiving his rights.  DE enters NC plea to amended charge.  Court will find DE guilty.  Both parties asking for rehabilitation.  Court will withhold sentance, place on propation for 1 yr. and pay court costs and DNA surcharge, 5 days credit.
